acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.026ppm of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 118mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of dust) value of 0.162mg/L (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 16mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 21mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 2000)) and 16mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 1999)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=-0.8(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance acts on (engineering) alloys including mild steel and copper according to ICSC (1999). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though classified as flammable under specific conditions according to ICSC (1999). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC, 1999)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the data on rabbit eye irritation tests (IUCLID (2000)): "Mildly irritating."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the results of rabbit skin irritation tests that suggest "no evidence of irritation" (though the results are those of 24 hour application) (IUCLID (2000)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "the present substance may adversely affect the nervous system and cause delayed neuropathy" (ICSC (J) (1994)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "mild tremor and aggressive behaviour" (HSDB (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Based on the human evidence including "miosis," "parasympatholytic agent" (RTECS (2004)), "unconsciousness, miosis, muscular fasciculations, sweating, and delayed neurotoxicity," "neuropathic target esterase (LNTE) inhibition (delayed neurotoxicity)," "retrobulbar ocular neuritis, thigh paresthesias, peripheral neuropathy and delayed neuropathy" (HSDB (2003)), "the present substance may adversely affect the central nervous system, causing convulsions and respiratory failure" (ICSC (J) (1994)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies: "tremors, salivation, chromodacryorrhea, dyspnea, rhinorrhea and clonic convulsions were observed," "abnormal gait, muscular fasciculations, tremor," "miosis, salivation, rhinorrhea, ataxia and central nervous system depression" (HSDB (2003)). 
The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1. However, as the referenced study is assigned a priority rating of 2, which does not meet the criteria for 1b (3) specified in the "Technical Guideline for GHS Health Hazard Classification," the substance is placed in Category 2.
